result.markdown: --- title: "\U0001F4CE Correlations" subtitle: "Correlations" author: "Arvind Venkatadri" date: 22/Nov/2022 date-modified: "2023-02-09" order: 30 abstract: "How one variable changes with another" format: html #fig-format: retina code-fold: false code-summary: Show the Code code-tools: true code-line-numbers: true code-overflow: scroll code-copy: true fig-align: center reference-location: margin cap-location: margin highlight-style: tango df-print: paged section-divs: true number-sections: true execute: freeze: auto tags: - Correlations - Scatter and Bubble Plots - 2D Density Plots - Heatmaps - Regression Lines --- # {{< fa folder-open >}} Slides and Tutorials | | | | | |---------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | R Tutorial   | Orange Tutorial | Radiant Tutorial  | Datasets | # Setup the Packages ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/setup_d98eee44fff1dff14f4fdac02cbc9a8c'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(palmerpenguins) library(patchwork) library(ggformula) library(mosaic) library(GGally) library(corrplot) #library(grid) ``` ::: # What graphs will we see today? Some of the very basic and commonly used plots for data are: - Scatter Plot - Contour Plot - Correlogram - Heatmap ## What Correlation Charts can we plot with Numerical / Quantitative Data? ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/charts_0ad7da3526bc7ac6558ce22575a2a60e'} ```{.r .cell-code} mpg <- mpg %>% mutate(drv= as_factor(drv)) p <- ggplot(mpg, alpha = 0.3) p1 <- gf_point(cty ~ hwy, fill = ~drv, colour = ~drv, data = mpg) %>% gf_smooth(method = "lm", title = "Scatter Plot with Correlation/Regression/Trend Line") p2 <- gf_density_2d(cty~hwy, data = mpg, title = "2D Density Plot") p1 + p2 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/charts-1.png){width=4200} ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/pairs-charts_79e17f39210bb1523ba9644f99bbbf06'} ```{.r .cell-code} p2 <- GGally::ggpairs(mpg, columns = c("hwy", "cty", "displ","cyl"), diag = list("densityDiag"), title = "Pairwise Correlations Plot") p2 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/pairs-charts-1.png){width=4200} ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/cor-plot_11005e7dc0f448e073b71208e04f9b3a'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(corrplot) mpg_num <- mpg %>% select(hwy, cty, displ, cyl) mydata_cor <- cor(mpg_num) corrplot(mydata_cor,method = "ellipse",type = "lower",main = "Correlogram") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cor-plot-1.png){width=4200} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Heatmap with numbers corrplot.mixed(mydata_cor, lower = "color", upper = "number", bg = "wheat", tl.pos = "d", main = "Heatmap?") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cor-plot-2.png){width=4200} ::: ::: ## A Workflow in Orange How does one calculate and visualize Correlations in Orange? {{< video https://youtu.be/Bd7n9FdY3g0 >}} Here is the help page on Correlations in Orange: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_ce5087b7afdc01a38f777ed3fed8693d'} ::: ## References 1.
